llama3.1.full_ans:
After evaluating the context information, I found that the documents indeed support the triple. Here is the response in JSON format:

```
{
  "output": "yes"
}
```

The relevant sentences from the documents are:

* "Pascal was hugely influenced by Montaigne’s writings and this could be the reason why they shared more of the same thoughts." (from file_path: /Users/stefanomarchesin/Research/fshami/Rag/docs/dbpedia_8470/re-ranker-msmarco/42.txt)
* "Montaigne had a direct influence on writers the world over, including René Descartes, Blaise Pascal..." (from file_path: /Users/stefanomarchesin/Research/fshami/Rag/docs/dbpedia_8470/re-ranker-msmarco/56.txt)
* "Much of Blaise Pascal's skepticism in his Pensées has been attributed traditionally to his reading Montaigne." (from file_path: /Users/stefanomarchesin/Research/fshami/Rag/docs/dbpedia_8470/re-ranker-msmarco/39.txt)

These sentences all suggest that Blaise Pascal was indeed influenced by Michel de Montaigne.
